intro: Senecio danyausii var. alyssoides, commonly known as the Alyssoides groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from yellow to white. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
